metadata.title: CVE-2013-4243 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the readgifimage function in the gif2tifftool in libtiff 4.0.3 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted heightand width values in a GIF image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4243` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.1
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.1
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.1
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.1').
